sen.j: 乃木恒子（のぎつねこ、1885年-1886年）は、明治期の陸軍軍人である乃木希典・乃木静子夫妻の長女（第三子）。
sen.e: Tsuneko NOGI (1885-1886) was the eldest daughter (the third child) of Maresuke NOGI (military man in Japanese Army in Meiji era) and Shizuko NOGI.
Tsuneko NOGI (1885-1886) was the eldest daughter (the third child) of Maresuke NOGI (military man in Japanese Army in Meiji era) and Shizuko NOGI.
Tsuneko NOGI (1885-1886) was the eldest daughter (the third child) of Maresuke NOGI (military man in Japanese Army in Meiji era) and Shizuko NOGI.

sen.j: 栄養失調や、当時の流行病などの為、生誕の翌年に夭折した。
sen.e: She died young one year after her birth due to malnutrition and epidemic disease in those days.
She died young one year after her birth due to malnutrition and epidemic disease in those days.
She died young one year after her birth due to malnutrition and epidemic disease in those days.
Her age at death was 2 (by the traditional Japanese system).
Her age at death was 2 (by the traditional Japanese system).
Her age at death was 2 (by the traditional Japanese system).

sen.j: 生没月日に関しては資料が無いので現時点では不明だが、グレゴリオ暦に於ける誕生日によっては満で数えた場合だと享年が0の可能性もある。
sen.e: Her birth and death was unknown due to lack of material but, her age at death could be 0 on the basis of Gregorian calendar.
Her dates of birth and death are unknown due to lack of material but, her age at death could be 0 on the basis of Gregorian calendar.
Her dates of birth and death are unknown due to lack of material but, her age at death could be 0 on the basis of Gregorian calendar.
Father: Maresuke NOGI (Army General).
Father: Maresuke NOGI (Army General).
Father: Maresuke NOGI (Army General).
Mother: Shizuko NOGI
Mother: Shizuko NOGI
Mother: Shizuko NOGI

sen.j: 長兄：乃木勝典（陸軍中尉）
sen.e: Eldest brother: Katsunori NOGI
Eldest brother: Katsunori NOGI (Army Liutenant)
Eldest brother: Katsunori NOGI (Army Liutenant)

sen.j: 次兄：乃木保典（陸軍中尉）
sen.e: The second elder brother: Yasunori NOGI
The second elder brother: Yasunori NOGI (Army Liutenant)
The second elder brother: Yasunori NOGI (Army Liutenant)
Young brother: Naosuke NOGI
Younger brother: Naosuke NOGI
Younger brother: Naosuke NOGI

sen.j: 恒子の遺骨は熊本県花岡山に納骨された。
sen.e: Tsuneko's ashes was placed in the Hanaoka Yama (mountain Hanaoka) in Kumamoto Prefecture.
Tsuneko's ashes was placed in the Hanaoka Yama (mountain Hanaoka) in Kumamoto Prefecture.
